intro: Nothorhipsalis, commonly known as the hybrid epiphytic cactus, is a genus of flowering plants in the Cactaceae family. These plants are typically epiphytic, meaning they grow on other plants without being parasitic, and they thrive in humid, well-drained environments. Nothorhipsalis species are native to Central and South America, where they are found in tropical and subtropical regions.
